sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: In order to set up the &admserv; the following requirements need to be met prior to installing the server:

listitem.para: Architecture: x86_64

2012-08-01 - fs: Recommendation OK?
RAM: at least 2 GB, 4 GB recommended
Harddisk: at least 40 GB

2012-08-01 - fs: Please review
Number of network cards: 2

important.title: Teaming support
important.para:
2012-08-01 - fs: Is this correct?
The network card used as eth0 needs to support NIC Teaming. If you are deploying the &admserv; on a virtual machine, be aware that fully virtualized NICs may not support teaming.

note.title: Virtual &admserv;
note.para: The &admserv; does not need to be a physical machine, you can also use a virtual machine. However, using a physical machine is recommended.

listitem.para: The network configuration on the nodes in the &cloud; network is entirely controlled by &crow;. Any network configuration not done with &crow; (e.g. with &yast;) will automatically be overwritten. Once the cloud is deployed, network settings cannot be changed anymore! By default the following networks will be created within the &cloud;:
192.168.124/24 (admin network to access the &admserv; and the &ostack; nodes)
192.168.122/24 (vLAN, public network to access the ‐ and the &vmguest;s)
192.168.123/24 (vLAN, network for inter-&vmguest; communication, internal only)
192.168.125/24 (vLAN, network for &store; (Swift), internal only)

If these default IP ranges do not met your requirements and/or if you follow the network proposal described at FIXME, you need to adjust the network configuration templates prior to running the &cloud; setup script. See FIXME for instructions.

Any additional network card (eth1+) on the &admserv; that is used to access other networks, must have a static IP address—DHCP is currently not supported. These interfaces will be shut down up by &crow; during the &cloud; setup process and will only be set up after the &admserv; installation has been finished. As a consequence, external repositories (if configured) need to be accessible from the first network card (eth0).
Network setup is completely controlled by &crow;
Network setup cannot be changed once &cloud; is deployed
NIC used for eth0 needs to support teaming
external repositories need to be accessible via eth0
additional network interfaces eth1+ need to be have a static IP address

sect2.title: Operating System Installation
sect2.para: Starting with a bare metal server, the first thing you need to do when deploying &cloud; is to install &sls; on the machine that should serve as the &admserv;.

Start the installation by booting from the &sls; 11 SP2 installation medium. For an installation overview refer to the &sls; &instquick;; detailed installation instructions are available in the &sls; Deployment Guide. Both documents are available at . The following will only cover issues that differ from the default installation process.

Installing the Add-On products &cloud; and ⪪ during the &sls; installation is recommended. Make sure to be able to access the installation media (DVD or iso image). Alternatively you may do the Add-On product installation after the &sls; installation.

If you have access to an ⪪ server within your organization, it is recommended using it for &cloud;, too. In this case skip the ⪪ Add-On product installation. If you have no access to an ⪪ server, installing it is required.

sect3.title: Add-On Product Selection
sect3.para: Click Include Add-On products from Separate Media on the Installation Mode screen. The Add-On product installation dialog will show up after proceeding with Next. Skip the network installation dialog if you have direct access to the installation media (e.g. via DVD or USB stick). Add the &cloud; and ⪪ products and proceed with the installation. Consult the &sls; Deployment Guide at for detailed instructions.

sect3.title: Partitioning
sect3.para: &cloud; has no special requirements in regards of partitioning. However, it is recommended to create a separate partition or volume for /srv. This partition will host all update repositories mirrored by ⪪ as well as the complete data from the &sls; and &cloud; installation media for the node deployment. A size of at least 25 GB is required. Help on using the partitioning tool is available at .

sect3.title: Product Registration
sect3.para: If you have installed the ⪪ Add-On product, you must register your &sls; version at the &ncc; now, otherwise you will not be able to configure the ⪪ server. You have received a &sls; registration key with the &cloud; &admserv; subscription. See for details on the &ncc; registration.
